p: The agar disc diffusion method was used to evaluate the antibacterial activities of the EOs [ 52]. Briefly, an overnight cultures of MRSA cells grown at 37 °C were diluted to a density of 0.5 McFarland standards turbidity (DENSIMAT, Bio-merieux, Marcy l’Etoile, France) and were streaked onto Mueller–Hinton agar (MHA) plates using a sterile swab. A sterile filter disc (diameter 6 mm) was placed and then was impregnated by R. officinalis, T. zygis, and O. majorana EOs (10 μL /disc). The plates were maintained at 4 °C for 2 h and then incubated at 37 °C for 24 h. After incubation, the antibacterial activity was evaluated by determining the zone of growth inhibition throughout the discs.
